citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
A tiger was limping on the left rear and then right rear leg intermittently during inspection. Initially the limp was
pronounced, but then it was difficult to appreciate when the animal slowed down. The facility had not identified the limp or
communicated it to the attending veterinarian at the time of inspection. Facility must observe animals daily to assess their
health and well-being and communicate timely and accurate information on problems of animal health, behavior and well
being to the attending veterinarian.

In the last 9 months, there have been three events of stress- induced trauma of 2 deer housed in an enclosure. In January
2024, employees reported finding a neighbor's dog running around the deer enclosure, panicking the deer, and resulting
in self injury to the deer . In February 2024, the deer had another stressful event ( an employee cutting grass around the
enclosure) which panicked them and caused reinjury. The third event occurred 8/4/2024 as the deer were found in a state
of panic and had new wounds. The facility added additional fencing after the first event, but this mitigation effort was
unsuccessful and two additional incidents occurred. Handling of all animals shall be as expeditiously and carefully as
possible in a manner that does not cause behavioral stress or unnecessary discomfort.
Correct by: 08/23/2024
The disposition of one macaw and one ring tailed lemur are still under review.
The inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Facility Representative.
Additional Inspectors:
Gustavo Soberano, Assistant Director
Laurie Gage, Field Zoological Species Specialist n
